About Julie Sass

Julie Sass (b.1971) studied visual art at The Royal Danish Academy of Fine Arts in Copenhagen and at New York University in New York City (MFA), where she specialized in painting. Later she received her MA in Theory & Mediation from The Royal Danish Art Academy in Copenhagen. Sass has worked for Yoko Ono and Gilbert and Lila Silverman’s’ Fluxus Collection as an assistant to Jon Hendricks, New York. She has also worked as assistant to Narelle Sissons producing set design for theater (Julliard, Shakespeare in the Park, etc.), New York.
Focusing on Abstraction (painting) in its diverse forms and how visual art can be embedded in various contexts, Sass has taken several initiatives to exhibitions, solo and collaborating with: Milena Høgsberg, Tomas Lagermand Lundme, Courtney J Martin, Bodil Nielsen, Anna Fro Vodder
